results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

results.title: Rube Goldberg Newsreel
results.brief_description: Rube Goldberg drew animated cartoons for newsreels distributed by the Pathe Company. This rare footage features him working on the animations.

constellations_other.name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
constellations_other.description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: On the gunline
results.creator_credit: Supreme Films and Department of the Navy
results.brief_description: The Australian guided missile destroyer HMAS Perth at war in Vietnam. Shows the routine of war for the officers and men, self maintenance and preparations at the U.S. Navy base at Subic Bay in the Philippines, underway replenishment of fuel and ammunition and action on the gunline off South Vietnam.

results.title: One Day Soon
results.brief_description: A production that shows how handicapped people can live independent lives and how they cope with their unique situation. This video has won the Television Society Penguin Award and the Mobile Award.

results.title: Tom Olsson's Cohuna
results.brief_description: Cohuna - When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector in 1952, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting film give us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950’s Victoria. The school recieved their projector, and Olsson’s films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.brief_description: In 1912, Dandy Hams and Bacon commenced at premises located in Dandenong, Melbourne. This short film is a rare record of Dandenong’s first major industry and features reminiscences by Maurie Jarvis (filmmaker Sue Jarvis’s father) who worked at Dandy from the age of 15 until he retired, first as a truck driver and then as a Sales Manager. Now aged 86 Maurie remembers quite fondly of his time at the Dandy Bacon Factory and talks about its operations and processes to a background of rare archival images of the factory buildings, its machinery and its workers. Sadly none of these buildings now exist.

results.title: First job after leaving school (c.1916)
results.brief_description: Interviewee Nin Martin from Goldsborough (near Dunolly) talks about his first job as a young lad in 1916 working for a mining company and how he, along with other young boys, used only a hammer to crush open the stones of quartz mined by the older diggers, in order to find the layer of molybdenum which was needed to strengthen the steel in the making of munitions for the war.
